content: FWIW, this seems fine to me, but I don't think it'd really improve the UI much. It's relatively infrequent that people are reading primitive and keyword pages.
The "copy path to clipboard" feature in general feels like an eyesore to me
Maybe after the "make source links prettier" PR lands, we could make the copy to clipboard icon instead be the text "copy path" and move it next to the source link? I feel like that'd reduce clutter.

It's also possible it's not as needed anymore? When it was introduced, it was hard to select the path for copying, due to some weird DOM structure. Nowadays it should be much easier to select and copy the path using the normal mouse mechanism.
If we got rid of the "Struct" (etc.) prefix, it'd be even easier to copy, since you could just triple-click
Maybe better to make a poll or something
UI changes like that always have surprising results
As most of the path consists of clickable links, selecting it manually is still pretty finicky
I wonder if we should get rid of those links? I think I've pretty much never used them.
It's super convenient to go to the parent(s) module(s)
ever since @jsha added the underline on them, I started using them a lot
I don't think I added the underline on hover! Looks like it's been there since 1.46.
what about hiding the icon on mobile? it seems less useful there, and space is more precious there.
That seems like it might be an improvement, but FWIW, I'm using rustdoc on a computer most of the time and it's there where I find the icon annoying.
